intro: Gonostemon pillansii, commonly known as the Pillans' gonostemon, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
